titleStmt.title: The true Protestants humble desires to the Kings most excellent Majesty. Or, Protestant-like propositions for His Majesties perusall, tending to a safe and well-grounded peace. VVith a commination or chorus of the people against those that desire it not.

notesStmt.note: Verse - "That your Majesty will be pleased to signe".
Column 3 line 1 reads "A commination to be confir-". Variant: column 3 line 1 reads "A comination to be confirmed".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
